intro: Veratrum maackii f. longebracteatum, commonly known as the long-bract veratrum, is a variant of the evergreen perennial herb native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant features large, lance-shaped leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. Its flowers are white and arranged in a panicle, with long, narrow bracts that give the plant its distinguishing name. This subspecies is known for its toxic alkaloids and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
